cs671

Class Tester

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs671.Tester
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public abstract class Tester
extends Object
implements Runnable
    Test runner. This class is used to run the tests methods (annotated with @TestMethod) found in classes that implement Testable.

    Instances of this class exist in two flavors, whether they run a single test class (see makeTester) or a suite of test classes (see makeSuite). Suites can be nested. They cannot be empty. All the test classes (or sub-suites) in a suite are processed in order. All the test methods in a test class are invoked in string order of their names. Furthermore, they are all invoked on the same instance.

    Test classes have type Testable. A beforeMethod is run before each test method. If this method returns false (or fails), the corresponding test is not run. An afterMethod is run after each test, whether the test was successful or not. It is not run of the test was not run. Failures in the afterMethod are reported as warnings but have no further effect.

    In general, no-argument methods are valid test methods if they are annotated, even when they are non-public or non-void. Static method and methods that require arguments are ignored. A warning is displayed if they are test-annotated.

    Tests results are produced as immutable TestResult instances. No pass/fail report is generated. I/O is used to report problems with test classes (which are disctinct from failed tests), including incorrectly annotated methods, classes that fail to load, classes that cannot be instantiated, etc. These are reported either as ERRORS (no tests are run) or as WARNINGS (some tests are run). By default, errors and warnings go to System.err but they can be redirected or even ignored (see setPrintWriter).

    A tester can only been run once (whether directly or as part of a suite). Any attempt to run it again will result in a IllegalStateException,

    Instances of this class are not safe for multi-threading.

    Version:
    2.0, 01/26/14
    Author:
    Michel Charpentier
    See Also:
    TestMethod, Testable

    • Method Detail

      • setPrintWriter

        public abstract void setPrintWriter(PrintWriter w)
        Sets the tester output. By default, the output is System.err. It is valid to set the output to null, in which case the tester is completely silent.
        Parameters:
        w - the output for tester info; can be null

      • run

        public abstract void run()
        Runs all the tests in the test class or suite.
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this tester has already been run.

      • getResults

        public abstract List<TestResult> getResults()
        Test results. This method returns a list that contains a TestResult object for each test that was run (in the order the test method were actually run). The returned list can be modified and modifications have no affect on this tester (i.e., this method make a copy of the list of results)
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the tester has not yet been run

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)

      • makeTester

        public static Tester makeTester(Class<? extends Testable> tests)
        Creates a tester for a single test class. This method only creates the tester. It makes no attempt to load the class, instantiate it, look for test methods, etc.

      • makeSuite

        public static Tester makeSuite(Tester... testers)
        Creates a tester for a suite of testers.

      • makeSuite

        public static Tester makeSuite(List<? extends Tester> testers)
        Creates a tester for a suite of testers.
